On a massive (but some how unnoticeable from afar) stage decorated with dark red curtains with a golden star and a silver rose on them, bright green and blue fairy lights and violet tinsel in a forest where snow covered the trees and a plethora of fictional characters from many different worlds were sitting on plastic chairs with expressions that ranged from slightly confused to annoyed beyond believe, a young girl stood holding a microphone.

"Hey what's cracking off, Fandom?" she said (or rather "yelled") while waving her hand. Noticing that this was doing nothing to further the non-existent plot OR keep anyone from killing her, she cleared her throat and spoke calmly

It was at this point that several kunai came flying at her, and she only barely managed to dodge them. Nervously, she said "Ah-alright then. First off, we have.......

(Announcer, Leon, Nightmare Moon, Both, Shadowbolt(s)) (note: Leon is my OC. If you want info about him, e-mail me)

(Link for the song: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ce1hg63C...)

"Okay, folks! For our next song, we have "Be Prepared", from the Lion King 1 movie. And, while this song is usually performed by a single male singer, this time it'll be performed by two singers, one male and one female. Now, let's greet our singers! The female singer...!"

*drum rolls*

"Nightmare Moon, from My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic in her Anthro form!"

The crowd cheered as the curtians parted to reveal a pitch black Alicorn woman. She was, at least, a head and half higher than the regular human. She had two majestic wings, ethereal mane and tail and a magnificent spiralled horn that indicated her status. She was not wearing her usual light blue armor. Instead, she was wearing a strapless midnight-blue dress that reached her hooves. The dress had many brilliant dots all over. If one were to pay attention, if would look like she was wearing a piece of the night sky itself. It also was clearly designed for her, because it had open spaces in the back for her wings and her tail. She was also mearing a tiara on her head that was silver colored with five small jewels on it. Two on the left side, two on the right side and one on the center. The jewels that were at the tips of the tiara were pearls, the ones at the front were sapphires. All on them were star shaped. And completing the tiara, was a beatifully crescent-moon shaped onyx stone right on the center. Thee jewels had been clearly marved by professionals. No amateur could match the skills that they were done with.

"Hello, everyone! How are you this fine night? Now, tell me! Are you ready for some sweet music?"

The crowd roared with cheer and were very anxious and eager for the show to begin.

"Thank you for your words, your highness. Now, for our male singer, we have someone unexpected. May I present, Leon! The son of Nightmare Moon!"

Audience: "EH?!?!?!"

The curtains parted to reveal a young man. He looked to be on his late teens and was as tall as his mother. His hair was short with three spikes that looked like inverted waves and pointed to the left. His eyes were teal colored, like Nightmare's but with normal slits. His body was quite bulky and well built. His clothes were practically pure black. He was wearing a t-shirt, jeans pants, sneakers, biker gloves with silver steel spikes on the knuckles, sun-glasses that were hanging froom his t-shirt, a legitimate leather jacket that had silver steel spikes on the shoulders and a stetson hat.

"I know this is a shocker to everyone. It was for me too when I found out. But we're here to sing, not to judge! Now, why dont you come over here and introduce yourself to the crowd, Mr. Leon?"

The announcer passes the microphone to Leon.

"Certainly. But, please, just Leon will suffice. Now, everyone, as you heard, my name is Leon Midnight Seiryu Moon. And I'm the son of the mare that I'm proud to call mother, Nightmare Moon."

Suddenly, Leon felt someone, or better saying, somepony, hughing him from behind. He looked back and, as expected, found his mother hugging him.

"Thank you, Leon."

"No need to thank me, mom. I just told the truth. No matter what anyone says about you, I'll always be proud to be your son. And I wouldn't change you for anyone else. Not now, not ever."

Nightmare teared up a bit from hearing that.

Audience: "Awwwwwwwwwww!!!"

"Now then, are you ready, your majesties?"

"Sure am, pal. Sure am."

"Me too."

Nightmare then used her magic to reate a bunch of Shadowbolts.

"This guys will do the chorus."

"Good! Now, get ready to begin in 5!"

"4!"

"3!"

"2!"

"1!"

"GO!!!"

(Begginning of the song)

"We never thought ponies essential. Their hides are unspeakably bright.
But maybe they've a glimer of potential
If all that they knew was our night..."

"We know that your powers of rettention
Are as dim as the sky is outside
But thick as you are
Pay attention!
Our words are a matter of pride."

"This long centuries
They've been torment
The stars saw the tears on our faces
But now there arises a potence
Of new management!
In this place."

"So prepare for a night everlasting!
Be prepared for sensational news!"

"The reign of the nightmare
Is tip-toeing nearer."

"And where do we feature?"

"Just listen to the teachers."

"We know it sounds sordid
But you'll be rewarded
When the stars aid in cutting us loose."

"There's now waking from this nightmare."

"Be Prepaaaaaaaaared!"

"Yeah, we'll be preppared! Be preppared for what?"

"For the Night Eternal."

"But, dosen't Celestia control the Sun?"

"Yes, but we'll imprison her. And take the Elements of Harmony too..."

"That's a grat idea! Who needs a ruler?
No princess, no prince. La-la-la-la-laaa-la!"

"Idiots! There will be a princess and a prince!"

"But you said-"

"WE will be a princess and a prince.
Stick with us, and you'll never go unnoticed again!"

"Yeah! Yeah! Hurray!
Long live the rulers!
Long live the rulers!!
LONG LIVE THE RULERS!!!"

"At last we will all be connected
With two rulers that all will adore."

"Of course, quid pro quo, you're expected
To take certain duties on board..."

"At last all this ponies will cower
Of sunlight they'll not a spark
But altough the night lasts forever
Don't think that you can hide in the dark!!!"

"Be prepared foe the cup of the century!
Be prepared for the murkiest scam!"

"Meticulous planning
Tenacity spanning
A thousand year exile
Is simply why we'll..."

"Be rulers eternal!
Our empire nocturnal!
And seen for the wonders we are!!!"

"There's no waking from this nightmare!
Be prepaaaaaared!!"

"Yes, there's no waking from this nightmare."

Leon+Nightmare+Shadowbolts: "BE PREPAAAAARED!!!"

*Colective evil maniacal laughter!!!"

(End of the song)

As soon as the song ended, the crowd exploded wit cheers! Everyone had loved their performance!

"Wonderful! Simply wonderful, your hignesses! And might I add that you make a great singing couple! Makes us wonder why you didn't got a song on the show."

"Oh, you're not the only one wondering about that. But it dosen't really matters."

"Oh? Why's that?"

"Because, wether they think we have talent or not, WE know that we have. Thus, we don't really care what they think."

"That's a very nice way to think, Leon. Anyway, thank you very much for your time!"

"No problem! Oh! And don't hesitate to call again if you want us to sing again, okay?"

"Yeah! We enjoyed ourselves. And from the reaction of the audience, they had fun to. Am I right, everyone?"

Audience: "YEAAAAAAAHH!!!"

"Will do, your highnesses! Will do!"

"Well then, shall we go, Leon?"

"Eeyup! Let's go mom. We did promised Pinmkie that we would arrive in time for her party."

Leon's hands and Nightmare's horn began to glow and, in a second, they were gone.

"Now, let's greet our next contestants!"

"Ladies and Getlemen! For our next performance, we have a real dark treat! Our next song is "Don't go by the river" from Aurelio Voltaire. Now, please welcome our performers! First! We have the King of Darkness Himself! KIIIIING SOMBRA!!!"

The curtains began to open and, as soon as a small crevice was visible, a black/grey mist emerged from behind the curtains and began to solidify on the stage. Once he was fully formed, the King emerged from the mist.

The king was wearing his costumary armor, which consisted on the legs, arms and torso protections, and a crown worthy of a king. He took a look at the crowd and shook his head while smiling maliciously.

"Ahh. So many free people without a leader to guide them. No, no. This simply will not do. But worry not everyone! Once this concert is all over, I'll be glad to become your king as well, my soon to be loyal slaves!"

Rather than cheering, the crowd simply stared at the king in fear and uncertainity. They liked him as a villain, but no way in tartarus did they wanted to be slaves!

"Er... Thank you, your highness..."

The king simply shrugged. "It's no problem.", he said with a satisfied smirk.

"Yes, well... Anyway, our next performer is none other than DOCTOOOOR FACILIER from the Disney version of The Princess and the Frog!"

An odd and eerie, if rythmic music began playing. Everyone recognaized it as Facilier's trademark theme.

"Hello everyone! What a nice audience we have tonight!", he said, while bowing and courtesing with his top hat.

This time, the crowd did cheered. Much to Sombras annoyance. He didn't liked one bit that this wizard wannabe was stealing his spotlight AND the attention and affection of his soon to be slaves!

"Welcome Mr. Facilier."

"Oh please. None of thois formalities. Not tonight! After all, we're all here to have some fun!"

"Hmph! Who invited this simpleton?!"

"Now, now, my dear king, I'm simply here for everyone's entertainment! Myself included, of course. Anyway, shall we sing, oh mighty Dark Lord?"

"Tch. Very well. Let us get this over with. The sooner this is over, the sooner I can take my newest slaves to their new home."

The crowd and the announcer visibly paled at the prospect of being Sombras' slaves.

"Alright! Let's go everyone!"

124132.content:
Note: This chapter serves to provide background story and has nothing to do with the previous times in which Twilight has appeared. You could say she's from an alternative universe. Also, her name changed. Now she's called Twilight Eris Starlight.

She replaces Tatsumi as Esdeath's love interest. Unlike Tatsumi, Twilight does love Esdeath. More than she'd admit to the other Night Raid members. Also, their past is different. Twilight and Esdeath met in her village (originally Tatsumi's) when they were children, Esdeath's father being good friends with the Village's Chief, who was Twilight's grandfather. They used to playtogether and were firmly joined to the hip, thus it was dificult to see one without the other whenever she and her father visited the village or whenever Twilight and the Chief visited Easdeath's tribe.

This friendship between them soon turned into something more. A simple crush at first, then into love. Tough neither had found the nerve to confess to the other so far.

However, soon the time came to part when Esdeath's father had to leave and go to the Empire's Capital looking for work. And of course he would take his daughter with him. By this time, Twilight was 13 and Esdeath was 16.

Twilight had wanted for Esdeath to stay with her, having heard horrible things about the Empire and it's corruption and she also had a terrible feeling in her heart that she couldn't explain. Esdeath however ignored Twilight's warning, thinking her friend, and secret love, was simply being paranoid and silly. This lead to a fallout between them, and parting ways in, less than favorable circumstances.

Now, 5 years later, Easeath is the greatest General the Empire has ever had and one of the strongest persons in all of the Empire, while Twilight is part of the group of assassins known as Night Raid, who work in tandem with The Revolutionary Army.

Twilight had entered a "tournament", tough it was more of a circus filled with weaklings in her opinion. Night Raid's plan having been that she would win the tournament to draw the attention of the Empire's General, who wuld be the judge on the tournament, and infiltrate in the army as a spy.

The plan worked, too well. She had drawn the attention of someone alright. That person being no other than General Esdeath.

As soon as they laid eyes on each other, they froze. Here they were, after so many years, reunited once more. Esdeath had been overjoyed at seeing her beloved again and at having a chance to patch things up from their last meeting.

Twilight was feeling too many emotions at the same time to simply focus on one. She was feeling in extasis at meeting her mate again, saddened at seeing her wearing the colors of the wretched Empire, shocked at Esdeath being a General, and the Empire's finest at thet, and a deep, burning fury. Not at Esdeath, oh no. She was furious with the other Night Raid members, especially Najeenda!

During one night, the members of Night Raid had gathered and, as a form of bonding, it had been proposed that they shared their reasons for fighting and what they wished to reveal of their backgrounds. Twilight had told them about her and Esdeath's shared childhood, just as the others had told her something about themselves.

A few days later, Najeenda had given Leone, Lubock and herself this mission. There was simply no way that Najeenda did not know that Esdeath was the General and that she would be atending the torunament! That bitch knew, and she still sent her to the fray and to the very likely scenario in which she would have to fight her beloved Esdeath!

So yes, she was feeling enraged. Murderous even! She had fully intended to have a, talk, with Najeenda once she returned.

Her toughts had been brought to a halt when she heard the distinct *clinck* of a collar and the rustling of a thin chain. Looking down, she saw that her beloved had collared her and, from the look in her eyes, intended to take Twilight with herself to somewhere private, likely her bedchambers.

Twilight looked at her with sad, sorrowful eyes, shook her head and teleported away, confusing everyone in the arena and leaving a shocked and distraught Esdeath behind. However, Esdeath wasn't the Empire's finest for nothing. She immediately ordered her best infiltration agent, Kurome, to track and follow Twilight magical signature. However, she also gave very specific orders that Twilight was not to be harmed, or there would be serious consequences. Kurome nodded and departed. Her superhuman speed allowing her to find Twilight and co. easily.

Once she found her quarry, Kurome noticed that the mare looked both, very saddened and, if she was reading the fierce and aggressive aura around the pony correctly, furiously murderous. She entered along with her quarry, becoming slightly shocked when she saw her older sister, Akame, and stuck to the ceilings, as hardly enyone ever looked up. While she did that, she was recording everything that happened, both as her report to Esdeath-sama and for any weakness she could find on her sister. And she also constantly checked her ear-piece, which was a comunicator linked directly to those of the other Jaegers, including Esdeath.

Kurome wasn't surprised when everyone gave the mare wide berth, as anyone could tell she wasn't to be messed with at the moment, tough the blonde woman and the green haired boy looked like they want to question her.

Kurome followed Twilight until they reached an office where they found Najeenda. Twilight requested that they be left alone.

As soon as the door closed and it was clear that no one was eavesdropping, Twilight begun t oquestion, read interrogate, Najeenda. Calmly and coldly at first. But gradually becoming more furiorus with each answer Najeenda gave. However, Twilight's rage exploded when Najeenda uttered the words "for the greater good".

At that point, Twilight saw red. She used her magic to slam Najeenda to the wall and proceeded to beat her black and blue, the door refusing to open due to Twilight having sealed it shut with her magic. Kurome, and later on Esdeathl, would admit to herself that she was impressed with both, the techinques and the brutality displayed by the ponian.

Once Twilight was moderately tired, she got off silver haired woman and looked at her handiwork, having left Najeenda as a barely recognizable, and barely alive, lump of flesh covered in cuts, lumps, bruises and other kinds of physical injuries, as likely traumatized.

The mare unlocked the door, at which point the other Night Raid members barged into the office, having heard the commotion. Once they saw Najeenda's state, they were fully prepared to berate their, at the moment tentative, comrade. However, once they saw the glare on Twilight's face, they flinched and refrained from speaking. That is, until Twilight demanded to know if they were aware of the details of their mission.

At first, all of them played the confused card, until the heard the mare growl the way n impatient predator would. Then, slowly, some raised their hands, those being Leone, Lubock and Mine. Bulat, Scheele, Chelsea and Akane still had no idea of what was going on. Akane asked Twilight what had her in her current state.

Once Twilight had explained, Akane and the others all glared at those who knew of their plan. They knew this was a War against the Empire. However, it was one thing to go against the enemy, and another completely to betray the trust of a comrade and use their personal information to their own gain.

The worst part was that, while Leone looked guilty and apologetic, Lubock looke completely unrepentant and Mine looked liked she was fruirous at being berated and glared at, believing that what she and the others did was completely fine to do.

Mine was about to speak, probably to say something hurtful as usual. However, Twilight levitated her and Lubock and slammed them against the cavern's wall, the sound of stone and bones breaking echoing in the otherwise silent corridors.

The ponian turned and walke away to her room, with no one following, knowing that right now she needed to be alone. The only one who followed her was Kurome, due to her mission.

As soon as her quarry had closed the door to her room and reached her bed, the ponian sat down heavily on the bed, clearly exausted from the days' events, and, to Kurome's surprise, broke down in tears, holding her face between her hands, her back hunched and ears drooped to their lowest. She didn't wailed, Kurome didn't think it was necessary. Her sobs made what she was feeling perfectly clear.

All of a sudden, Kurome could swear she was hearing music, but there was no recorder on any other mechanism playing music anywhere!

Her thoughts were interrupeted when her quarry started singing, apparently being able to hear the music as well.

And while Twilight sang, she unknowingly was singing the same song and at the same time as Esdeath...

(Now dear reader, what was that song?)
124132.title: Esdeath (Akame ga Kill) + Twilight Sparkle (MLP)

1241321.content:

Kurome waitnfor a few seconds, then follows the mare. As much as she'd like to settle things with her sister, orders were orders. And her's were to follow and observe the mare for as long as Esdeath-sama said so.

Still, from what she had seen and heard, it was clear the mare was in love with her leader. And if she read her leader's body language correctly, plus her tone on her oders regarding the mare in question and the heavy emphasis on keeping the mare safe, then it was likely that her leader had fallen for the ponian.

Kurome herself wouldn't mind dating the mare. She certainly was beautiful and powerful. And she also had a secret attraction towards Esdeath-sama. If she lpayed her cards right, maybe all three of them could become mates, with Seiryu being a possible addition. Who knows?

But for the time being, she'd settle on strictly following her orders, until an opportunity presented itself...

14.content:
From the rear left side of the stage walks a tall thin man in a blue-gray trench coat, the foot steps of his black knee high boots snapping crisply above the low muttering from the audience. Gloves of red leather with wide cuffs stretching half way up his forearms were matched by a world war one era leather aviator’s helmet, complete with white goggles worn high up on the forehead. The protruding chin was balanced by an equally protruding nose. His thin lips were drawn back in a wide smile, showing of a set of perfectly even teeth while the narrow beady eyes looked at the audience in a calculating, almost predatory manor. As he sized up the assembled throng he used the finger and thumb of one hand to twist and curled the end of his pencil thin handlebar moustache. His first words were directed not at the waiting assembly, who were not listening in any case, but at his companion; a dog of indeterminable lineage that walked beside him, clad also in an aviator’s helmet and wearing a red scarf. “Well Muttley”, the man sneered confidently, “According to whatever rules they they have in this place, all we need to do is sing one little song and we’re free to leave. Then we can get back to catching that insufferable little pigeon for the General.” The only response from the dog was a sort of rasping laugh.
Before anything further was said there was a bright flash from the right hand side of the stage, and in the dark afterglow the audience could make out the shape of a slim cloaked woman. As she walked into the spotlights they could see she was dressed in a dark purple sleeveless body suit. What most in the audience had, at first, assumed to be a cape, was revealed instead to be long light brown hair that reached all the way down to the tops of her dark purple ankle boots.
Walking over to where the other two stood in the center of the stage she peered critically through the yellow lens of her sunglasses at them. I"It looks," she said in a soft voice, "as though this song is for three parts. Mind if I join you?"
“Not at all my dear,” spoke the man in a smooth voice, "not at all. Muttley and I would be delighted to have you join us, isn’t that right, Muttley?”
What Muttley said in response was an un-intelligible mutter, but the man ignored this as he continued. “I don’t believe we’ve been properly introduced my dear. I am Dick Dastardly, and my diminutive cohort here is known as Muttley.”
“Dastardly and Muttley, how interesting.. " The woman paused for a moment, evidently thinking, then spoke “You may call me Darcy”
“Darcy.” Repeated Dastardly, clicking his heels and inclining his head in a formal greeting. “We are pleased to make your acquaintance.”
“And I, yours. Would you by chance be any relation to Dastardly and Muttley of the famous Vulture Squadron?”
“One and the same, my dear,” Dastardly smiled “One and the same.”
“Yea!” muttered Muttley “Rick Rasterdly”
Dastardly surreptitiously aimed a kick at Muttley, then continued. “I take it you have heard of us?”
“Of course. No other squadron can boast of such an impressive record. I believe you shot down something like one ship, one train. a gas station, 182 aeroplanes, and 3 balloons!
“Ah ah ah,” said Dastardly, waving a correcting finger, “two balloons and a Zeppelin!”
Any further conversation was interrupted by the hiss of enormous speakers as somewhere back stage a jukebox came to life. The three stared about the stage for some clue on what was to happen next, then spotted a ribbon of words hovering in mid air directly in front of them.
After a glance at each other, Darcy and Dastardly begin to sing along to the words, while Muttley mutters along in tune.

As the accompaniment faded away the three performers took a bow. Before they could do anything else their images began to dissolve into bright patterns of light and then fade out. The last thing the audience heard was “Drat, Drat and double drat Muttley, I wanted to get her number.”

choices: I put your Picture Away (Sheryl Crow)
1411.content:
The crowd patiently paid absolutely no attention what so ever to the short line of people winding their way across the stage. To say they looked oddly out of place would be an un-necessarily re-iteration of the obvious. Every one was out of place in this place, and these four were no exception.
Of the tall and slightly built dark haired man at the front of the line the kindest thing you could say was that his nose was striking. If you were un-kind, as most people turned out to be, you might point out that it resembled the beak of a large bird, possible an ostrich or a turkey. His hair was also striking, being the closest thing to a black pile of spray painted straw most people would hope to encounter.
The plain white T-shirt that he wore, as well as the jeans they were tucked into, contained several small rips, tears, and dirt smudges. Not artistically placed ones designed to enhance an artificial image of handsome ruggedness, but the good honest wear experienced by a good honest hard working shirt worn by a good honest hard working man, who just may have happened to have fallen down a cliff fairly recently.
His boots too bore unmistakable signs of hard use; Scuffs and scrapes, and the rounding of the heels that mark boots well used; yet they were also well polished and carefully cared for. Instead of a coat he was wearing a button-less vest of grey leather. At odds with the basic normality of the rest of his clothing were the short black leather bracers he wore around each wrist. These were decorated with small, silver coloured conical studs, a theme that was continued on his belt, as well as on the thin choker collar he wore around his thin neck.
He could not have been said to be leading the group, even though he was at the head of the line; it was more like he had wandered into the spotlight and of the rest of the group had followed out of nervous curiosity.

The girl that followed most closely behind him was clothed inappropriately in a short pink dress, with soft boots of an impractical flower pedal design on her feet. A small pink conical cap with a flopped over tip covered the top of her head. Her outfit suggested that someone had been trying to capture the look of a full sized version of Tinker Bell, but had gotten cold feet at the last moment about the position of the hemline and just how much thigh would be showing. Dirt smudges and small tears whispered that, here too, was a person who walked too close to cliff edges. She also wore a black leather choker with silver studs that matched the one on the dark haired man, although you could just barely make it out under the long dark hair spilling over her shoulders. Her pretty face had the high cheek bones and long nose reminiscent of the American Apache Indian, although the effect was spoiled somewhat by the green colouration of her skin.
The furtive way she followed suggested that, although she absolutely did not mistake the two of them for a couple, she wasn’t about to let the man with dark hair get too far out in front.

The third member of the little group was close to a direct opposite of the dark haired man. To say he was a bit chubby would be like calling the ocean a bit damp. His girth truly looked to exceed his 5 foot 3 inch stature, and he not so much as walked as he wobbled back and forth, gradually moving forward. He was dressed in loud slacks of polyester, with a matching sports jacket whose colour scheme was reminiscent of neon signage. As if the plot needed more stereotyping his face wore the warm wide grin of a man who was constantly jolly. One who had, if not a new joke every day, at least an old one with a great punch line. And if it wasn’t a great punch line he would tell it like it was anyway. Here was the man your uncle Buck was trying to be every Christmas. You knew instinctively that this was a man on who you could count to liven up a cocktail party, who would be guaranteed to cheer you up, and from whom you would never, ever buy anything with the word pre-owned in the title.

The fourth member of the group was a burly gentleman dressed in canvas trousers and beige cable-knit sweater. The broad jaw and piercing blue eyes whispered of a Scandinavian heritage. The woolen toque covering his head said that if any of the group was to call themselves a sailor, this would be the one. The frayed rope belt echoed the sentiment. The man carried himself with a confidence that spoke loudly ‘If you’re organizing a side for rugby, here’s your first pick.’. The salt stains on his boots told of recent sea fairing experience. The duffle bag slung casually over the shoulder fairly shouted ‘We’re still keeping with the sailor theme here’!
You began to wonder if he was actually allowed to say any words for himself

At center stage the burly blond dropped his carry bag and grinned at the crowd as the others clustered around. “Now” his voice boomed, “We Sing!”
At this he grabbed the closest mike and began at the top of his voice…

Once we had a company
‘Til we all began to Disagree
Then John sued Paul, Paul sued Bob, and Bob us three,
It’s getting so confused, I think I just sued me!
Oh, I’ve been served with a yellow subpoena!
A yellow subpoena, a yellow subpoena…
Realizing that nobody else had joined in, he trailed off as he looked around at the astonished blank stares from the rest of the group.

“What?” he demanded.

“That’s not the way it goes” complained the fat man.

“You speak from reading words. Sven now, Sven speaks from experience!”

The dark haired man spoke up “Sven speaks from reading back issues of Heavy Metal.”

For a moment, the big Scandinavian glowered at him, then broke into a grin “OK Mark, you got me. I just happen to like Kierkegaard’s lyrics better McCartney’s.

The woman broke in with “Can we just get this over with? I’ve got a date with a warm bath and I’m way overdue.”

“Shall we try this again?” queried the man addressed as Mark

The fat man spoke up “First let me tell you about the two Irish guys who were in this pub.”

“That’s not a song.” Countered the woman

“Not at the start, no, but later after they get a few drinks on…”

We’re supposed to sing Yellow Submarine.

“Which one? The one from ‘Revolver’ or the one off the B side of Elanor Rigby?”

“Does it matter?” asked the woman in an exasperated tone.

“Not at all. They’re both the same.”

“Then why did you bring it up?”

“Cause I know a great revolver joke. Seems this guy finds a magic bottle on the beach…”

Can’t we just sing already?” the woman interrupted, rolling her eyes. She turned and said aside to Mark “Next time I have to pull you from the brink of certain death, can we leave Fred at home?”

“Hey” retorted Mark “It wasn’t my idea to bring him along.” After a pause he continued “Come to think of it, it never is!”

“I know,” the woman said, “It just makes me feel better to say it.”

Not to be deterred, the fat man spoke up again “So this Irish guy walks out of a bar!”
At the collective groan he looked around at the faces of his companions. “What? It could happen!”

Sven grinned at his companions again, then raised the mike once more.

In the town where I was born
Lived a man who sailed to sea
And he told us of his life
In the land of submarines
So we sailed up to the sun
Till we found a sea of green
And we lived beneath the waves
in our yellow submarine

The rest joined in the chorus:

We all live in a yellow submarine
Yellow submarine, yellow submarine
We all live in a yellow submarine
Yellow submarine, yellow submarine

Mark:
And our friends are all aboard
Many more of them live next door
And the band begins to play

All:
We all live in a yellow submarine
Yellow submarine, yellow submarine
We all live in a yellow submarine
Yellow submarine, yellow submarine

Fred (speaking into his hand to give a hollow echo like effect)
The captain says you can do it, Mr Boatswain, you can do it
Oh, Sgt. Of course I love you
But for god’s sake take your hand off the intercom button.

Mark:
What?

Fred:
As we live a life of ease
Every one of us has all we need
Sky of blue and a pint of green
In our yellow submarine

All
We all live in a yellow submarine
Yellow submarine, yellow submarine
We all live in a yellow submarine
Yellow submarine, yellow submarine
We all live in a yellow submarine
Yellow submarine, yellow submarine

They ended the performance to a smattering of applause.

“Thank You, Thank you” Fred bowed at the audience, “Hey, have you heard the one about the two nuns, the peanuts, and the cocktail dress?”

It seemed that this time the sparkling lights moved faster than usual.
1411.title: Yellow Submarine

1412.content:
The lights come up low, softly illuminating a room set in the center stage.
All the rest is dark, focusing your attention on the weak pool of light. The ceiling of the room is curved, the walls worked into the support ribs and bulkheads that make up the hull of a Galaxy Class Starship. A low cabinet, enclosing some vital piece of equipment, juts into the room. An access hatch and status panel, one light clearly blinking, could be seen at one end of the cabinet. On top a partial wall, half solid and half hexagon mesh, extended upward, dividing the room into two separate areas. The first was obviously a work space, containing as it did a triangular shaped desk and an odd shaped computer. The second area was just as obviously intended for sleeping, with a mattress set onto a raised platform.
Further proof of the area’s function was provided by the prone figure the mattress was supporting, one arm draped across the eyes in an attempt to block what little of the dim light spilled through the mesh.
In direct defiance of normal sleeping customs the figure lay on top of any bedding the mattress may have been covered with. In further defiance of sleeping traditions the figure was still fully dressed; Gold command tunic, black trousers, and, adding insult to the already injured rules of what to wear while sleeping, black uniform boots.
In defense of these transgressions, the reclining figure reveals itself to not, as was originally thought, be sleeping. The figure twitches and stirs restlessly, and after a few minutes levers itself upright, swinging its legs off the side, and sit up on the edge of the bed. Tiredly rubbing its face with both hands, the figure looks around the room, then begins, somewhat over dramatically, to speak.

“It's been a,, hard day's night, andI'vebeen,, Working,, like a dog”

As it speaks, the figure gets to its feet, crossing the room to touch a wall panel, causing the lights to brighten. Wincing at the increased illumination, the figures eyes blink rapidly, as if adjusting to the increased light.

“It'sbeena,, HARD! day's,, night, And I Should! Be,, sleeping,, likealog
But! When I! gethometoyou I,, findthethings that, YOU, do
Will make,, ME,, feelalright”

At this, the figure crosses the room into the work area and sits behind the desk, resting its head on its hands with its elbows on the table.

“You know, I work,, all day, to get,, Shoreleave,, tobuyyouthings”

The figure looks at the screen of the computer

“And it's worth it,, just. To. Hear. You. Say. You'regoingto Give. Me. Everything!
So whyonearth,, should. I. Moan,, 'cause when I,, get back on board
You know I! Feel OK”

At this, the figure gets to its feet and begins to pace back and forth,

“WhenI'mhome,, everything,, seems,, toberight
When I'M home,, feeling YOU,, holding me,, tight… Tight…”

As it paces and speaks, the figure gestures dramatically to emphasis various words.

“It's,, beenahard,, day's night, andIbeen working,, like,, a dog!
It's been,, a,, hardday'snight,, and,, I shouldbesleeping like,, a,, log
But,, when I,, get,, hometoyou, I find the things,, thatyoudo
Make ME! Feel. Allright”

“So why, on, Earth, shouldImoan, 'causewhen I,, get back on board
You know I,, feel OK”

“When I'm home,, everything seems,, toberight
When I'M! Home,, feeling YOU,, holdingmetight”

At this point, the figure returns to stand at the desk,

“It'sbeenahard day's night, and I,, been,, working like a dog
It's been a,, hard,, day's night, I! Should! Be sleepinglikealog
But when I get,, home to you I find,, the things,, that you do
Will make me,, feel alright”

The figure lays back onto the bed with hands clasped behind it’s head.
“You know,, I feel,, alright”
Whispers “I feel alright!”

Tfigure gets toits feet and gives a dramatic bow to the audience. After a few moments a hand is raised, waiting for the applause to die down.
Once the applause had dropped to a level where it could be heard clearly the figure spoke. “With a little practice,, in dramatically ACCENTUATING certain,, words, andpausing,, in,, strange,, placeswhenyou,, speak,, Then,, you too,, can,,TALK,, likewilliamshatner,, Every,, March 22nd!”

The lights dimmed, and the figure, desk, bed and entire set disappeared in sparkling lights.
1412.title: The SATAM Beatles: A Hard Days Night

15.content:
"....Hinata Hyuga singing Sally's Song!" The young announcer said gesturing to a very shy, but rather beautiful girl who stood on stage. She had long dark purple hair, pupil-less lavender coloured eyes and wore a black tank top under a purple and tan jacket, blue trousers, black sandals and a metal headband with a leaf on it. But what was particularly noticeable about her was the look of utter astonishment she had at that moment. "Wha-, but I" she said, as she did not consider herself to be much of a singer and wasn't sure if she wanted to be on stage at that moment. But then she thought about how much the song fitted her feelings for a certain knuckle head ninja, and decided to sing any way.

I sense that there's something in the wind
That feels like tragedy's at hand.
and though I would like to stand by him,
Can't shake this feeling that I have.
The worst is just around the bend,
But does he notice my feelings for him?
And will he see how much he means to me?
I think it's not too be.


What will be come of my dear friend?
Where will his actions lead us then?
Although I'd like to join the crowd, in their enthusiastic cloud?
Try as I may, it doesn't last.
And will we ever end up together?


No, I think not.
It's never to become, for I am not the one.


And with that, the song ended. The audience cheered their approval. But hardly any of them noticed that before a strange light engulfed her, transporting her to who knows where, she had shed but a single tear.
15.title: Hinata Hyuga (Naruto)/Sally's Song (TNBC)

info.brief_description: The day has finally arrived, all your favorite fictional characters singing random songs.
info.description:
You might have already guessed the point of this story. For some reason unknown to....well, EVERYONE, a load of fictional characters are being made to sing random songs. It is your job to decide what songs are going to be sung, who are going to sing them and why the songs are being sung. This was inspired by a combination of reading The-Poisoned-Doughnut-Of-Doom's story Doughnut's Done It Again on FanFiction.Net and listening to various songs late at night. I would like to mention a few rules before we begin:

*No killing off anyone: A character can go on holiday for a little bit, and sure they get injured, but NO DEATH!!!!
*No drugs.
*Try not to go overboard on swearing when the characters have stopped singing. If there is swearing within the actual song, then go ahead. Otherwise, no way.
*No chapters that just say "They start singing, {{i}insert song lyrics here{{/i} and they stop singing.
*Try to make the "story lines" end at 200 chapters.
And finally
*Add whatever songs/characters you want to add. You are definetly going to see plenty of "You Decide" choices, So you might as well let your imaginations run wild. BUT, do not take this as an excuse to do rubbish chapters involving the Jonas Brothers or some other crap!. Only fictional characters can sing in this story (you can use some of your own characters though). If i find any real person fan fiction, you will have a warning
Apart from that, feel free to add and enjoy.
